Name: Ulaanbaatar
Description: The capital city of Mongolia, known for its vibrant culture, modern development, and historical landmarks.

Name: Darkhan-Uul
Description: An industrial city in northern Mongolia, surrounded by rich natural resources and beautiful landscapes.

Name: Orkhon
Description: Known for its historical sites, Orkhon is home to ancient monuments and the Orkhon Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Name: Khovsgol
Description: A scenic region located in the north, famous for Khovsgol Lake, one of the largest freshwater lakes in Asia.

Name: Bayan-Olgii
Description: A remote region in the western part of Mongolia, known for its mountainous terrain and diverse ethnic groups.

Name: Dornod
Description: A region located in eastern Mongolia, known for its vast steppes, agriculture, and proximity to the Russian border.

Name: Tov
Description: Located near Ulaanbaatar, Tov is an administrative region with a growing urban and suburban population.
